metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14265 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A Stack-based Buffer Overflow was discovered in xtrans_interpolate in internal/dcraw_common.cpp in LibRaw before 0.18.3. It could allow a remote denial of service or code execution attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.5-1
libraw16 - 0.18.5-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> the two lines entry in changelog refers for CVE-2017-13735 and this CVE respectively

criterions.comment: darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
dcraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
exactimage: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
kodi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
libraw package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.5-1').
rawtherapee: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
